alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 6:31PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Montezuma County through 700 PM MDT... At 631 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cortez, or 36 miles west of Durango, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cortez around 635 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 33. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 30 and 47. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
